dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 4430 IH: Protecting the Sustainable Use of Spent Grains Act of 2014
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Womack (for himself, Mr. Welch, Ms. Pingree of Maine, and Mr. Gardner) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the FDA Food Safety Modernization Act to ensure that certain facilities continue to be treated as alcohol-related facilities, notwithstanding the distribution of spent grains resulting from the production of alcoholic beverages.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protecting the Sustainable Use of Spent Grains Act of 2014.

section.header: Applicability of exemption to alcohol-related facilities that distribute spent grains
section.text: Section 116 of the FDA Food Safety Modernization Act (21 U.S.C. 2206) is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting after subsection (b) the following:

subsection.text: Notwithstanding subsection (b), the exemption in subsection (a) shall not cease to apply to a facility on the basis of such facility distributing, for use as food for animals, spent grains resulting from the facility’s production of alcoholic beverages.

paragraph.text: in subsection (d), as redesignated, by striking Except as provided in subsections (a) and (b) and inserting Except as provided in subsections (a), (b), and (c).
